name: B. Ilya and tic-tac-toe game
statement:
Ilya is an experienced player in tic-tac-toe on the field. He always
starts and plays with Xs. He played a lot of games today with his friend
Arseny. The friends became tired and didn’t finish the last game. It was
Ilya’s turn in the game when they left it. Determine whether Ilya could
have won the game by making single turn or not. The rules of tic-tac-toe
on the field are as follows. Before the first turn all the field cells
are empty. The two players take turns placing their signs into empty
cells (the first player places Xs, the second player places Os). The
player who places Xs goes first, the another one goes second. The winner
is the player who first gets (horizontal, vertical or diagonal).
editorial:
This problem can be solved by simple bruteforce. Letâs brute cell in
which Ilya put X. Letâs put X in this cell. Next step is to check if
there is three consecutive Xs on field. This is done as follows. Letâs
brute cell which is first of three consecutive Xs. Next letâs brute
direction of three consecutive Xs. If we know first cell and direction,
we should check that there is three consecutive cells from first cell
towards fixed direction.
